Picture quality is decent for its asking price and I have no complaints. Color reproduction is precise and sharp for a 720p panel. Since I have paired this TV with an Android 7.1 TV Box ( costing INR 3.6K ) , I now have 1080p 32" Smart Android 7.1 TV for a total cost of rupees 14.5 K. The HDMI ports are placed very conveniently to the side . Make sure to use type A HDMI cables with SLIM heads . HDMI cables with fat plugs ( heads ) cannot be plugged in . I have not used the VGA or USB ports or cable TV connection ports. Windows users FYI: Ensure that under Graphic properties , the Resolution is set to 1080p and ,most importantly , the frequency is set to 60p Hz. Use the TV remote and set picture mode as " Panorama". ** Initial Impressions ** ‚óè The box had the TV, desktop stands & screws, warranty card and user manual ‚óè The bezel is very thin and is glossy black which gives a premium look to the TV from the front. The power cord is built into the TV that cannot be unplugged ‚óè There is a low profile TCL logo at the bottom center of the bezel. There are navigation buttons hidden below the logo incase the remote control does not work. The remote is quite handy and has a glossy black finish ‚óè There is a Connectivity Bay that faces back that houses these ports - VGA female port to connect computers - Component Video In phono plugs to connect DVD video - Left & Right Audio In phono plugs to connect DVD audio or computer audio - SPDIF ‚óè The bay that can be accessed from left houes these ports - Two USB ports - Two HDMI ports to connect HD set top box or Blu Ray player - Coaxial Antenna In to connect Cable TV or TV areal antenna - Audio Out left & right phono plugs to connect to external speakers ** Installation & Warranty ** ‚óè I got a call from TCL requesting TV installation on the day of delivery, but was before delivery. I could not reach them on phone once the TV was delivered to me. After two days, I called TCL customercare and raised a request. After waiting for three days, I self-installed the TV and then I was contacted by the technician! ‚óè Amazon told me its okay to self-install the TV, but need to get in touch with the local TCL service center to get the warranty registered. But, my local Service Center told me its not required and the Amazon bill is enough to claim warranty. Quite confusing and misinformed! But finally, I was told to send the bill and serial no over Whatsapp to the technician ‚óè Installation involved only the fixing of desktop stand which can be done if you have a star-screwdriver. But if you plan to wall-mount the TV, TCL technician will bring in the free wall-stand ** Usage & Performance ** ‚óè The TV turns on with a TCL animation which I did not like really. I disabled this from the Options menu ‚óè Clicking Menu button on remote opens a tile with options like TV, Multimedia, Source, Options, etc. The different sources are TV, AV, VGA, HDMI1, HDMI2 and Component Video - TV is for analog channels that goes through the inbuilt TV tuner. If you have a rooftop areal connected, you can watch Doordarsan - When VGA is selected, the TV will pick up video from VGA port and audio from Audio In phono plugs - You can connect set top box to HDMI port ‚óè The multimedia tile will take you to features to play video, music, photos, etc. I tested videos in mkv, avi, wmv and mp4 and all worked well. I played music files in mp3 formats only ‚óè The subtitles in English are displyed for USB movies, but not any other Indian languages ‚óè When turned on from Standby, the TV opens into the last input source you were in. If there is no signal from the selected source, the TV switches through all sources and stops at the first available signal ** Display & Sound ** ‚óè The display has got good brightness, richness & clarity and I dont have anything to complian about it. But if you sit too close in the order of 3 or 4 feets, 720p screen is sure to show up the pixels. But beyond that distance, you can't spot a difference between this display and a full HD display of the same size ‚óè I played a 1080p mkv movie from USB and every 20 or 25 seconds, there was a quick freezing of screen which was not there for videos in other formats ‚óè I have connected Sundirect HD DTH and it is a pleasure to watch the channels. Standard Definition videos in 4:3 format gets stretched to fill the screen in 16:9 ratio ‚óè I am very much impressed with the sound reproduction. I watched Avatar from USB and the preset Movie mode produced good bass effects which I really liked. There are two down-firing speakers which works really well ** I don't like these ** ‚óè While music is played, there is a nice graph visualisation displayed on the screen, but that is just a dummy and is very ugly as well ‚óè There should have been an option to turn the TV screen off while music is being played from USB ‚óè The remote has got a Return button that is supposed to take us back to the previous menu item, which does not work infact ‚óè The click quality of the remote is also not upto the mark, but the click feeling is really good. For some functions to work, I have click more than once ‚óè There is a white light below the TCL logo that turns on when the TV is on Standby. I dont like this which is very bright and looks very ugly for me at night ‚óè There is no way to browse through all the contents in a connected USB. If music is selected, only music files are displayed and the same for videos and photos. I prefer seeing all the contents of a connected device ** Summary ** ‚óè I had earlier purchased a 55 inch 4K TCL and is satisfied with that; it gave me the confidence to go for this one ‚óè I am quite happy with the input options, video & audio quality and USB playback. I paid Rs.13,490 in May-17 and I rate FOUR stars. One star off on all those things that I dont like.
